critique: This document is a directive from the President to the Secretary of the Treasury regarding the assembly of a Coast Guard Personnel Board. It is based on existing legislation (section 2 of the act of January 12, 1938). Given the limited scope and specific nature of the directive, it's difficult to assign strong biases along the given axes. The document itself doesn't express an ideological tilt, doesn't address immigration, has a neutral impact on executive power, doesn't significantly alter federalism, doesn't directly impact national security or civil liberties, has a neutral impact on economic regulation, and doesn't explicitly address social inclusion. Therefore, most scores will be close to zero.
